post.summary: Endpoint to import absences. Can also be used to create, update or delete absences.

get.summary:
Returns all absences within the given timeframe.
If no timeframe is provided, all absences are returned.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: If provided, only absences occurring after the start date will be returned.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: If provided, only absences occurring before the end date will be returned.

post.description: When the booking type property is not send at all, it won't be changed through the import. The default value on creation is 'Reservation'.

schema.description: Data container for a whole batch of users to import.
Data container for a whole batch of users to import.
Data container for a whole batch of users to import.

get.summary: Returns a list of booking which are linked to a certain project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The internal id of the project for which the bookings are loaded. Can be null, if a project code is provided.

parameters.name: projectCode
parameters.description: The external id of the project for which the bookings are loaded. If a project id is provided the project code is ignored.

get.summary: Get all bookings.

parameters.name: UserID
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter.

parameters.name: EmployeeID
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter. If UserID is provided, this will be ignored.

parameters.name: EndDateAfter
parameters.description: Filter on the end date of the booking. Null means no filter. Also returns bookings where the end date is null.

parameters.name: StartDateBefore
parameters.description: Filter on the start date of the booking. Null mean no filter. Also returns bookings where the start date is null.

parameters.name: UsersBusinessUnitID
parameters.description: Filter on the business unit of the booked user. Null means no filter.

parameters.name: UsersBusinessUnitName
parameters.description: Filter on the business unit of the booked user. Null means no filter. If UsersBusinessUnitID is provided, this will be ignored.

parameters.name: UsersPracticeAreaID
parameters.description: Filter on the practice area of the booked user. Null means no filter.

parameters.name: UsersPracticeAreaName
parameters.description: Filter on the practice area of the booked user. Null means no filter. If UsersPracticeAreaName is provided, this will be ignored.

parameters.name: ProjectID
parameters.description: Filter on the project linked to the booking. Null means no filter.

parameters.name: ProjectCode
parameters.description: Filter on the project linked to the booking. Null means no filter. If ProjectID is provided this will be ignored.

parameters.name: UsersTeamID
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter.

parameters.name: UsersTeamCode
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter. If TeamID is provided this will be ignored.

parameters.name: CreatedOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter. It gets hold of the bookings that have been created on or after the entered timestamp. Expected format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" (see ISO 8601). Please indicate the the timezone ("Z" for UTC), otherwise local time will be assumed.

parameters.name: LastUpdatedOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Filter on the booked user. Null means no filter. It gets hold of the bookings that have been updated on or after the entered timestamp. Expected format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ" (see ISO 8601). Please indicate the the timezone ("Z" for UTC), otherwise local time will be assumed.

get.summary: Lists all possible booking accounting types.
Lists all possible booking rejection reasons.
Returns a description of all possible custom properies for bookings.

post.description: The endpoint uses the company id, the company code and the company name to match with existing companies.

get.summary: Returns all companies.

post.summary: Creates or updates a company. Will be removed in a future version.
post.description: The endpoint uses the company id, the company code and the company name to match with existing companies.

get.summary: Returns the core project data.
get.description:
Either projectid or projectcode must be provided.

For a quick existence check use the http method HEAD instead instead of GET.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: decídalo id of the project.

parameters.name: projectcode
parameters.description: External id of the project.

400.description: If neither projectid nor projectcode is provided.

404.description: If no project with the given projectid or projectcode is found.

head.description:
Only checks if the project exists, but does not return any body content.

If you want to get the project data, use the GET method instead.

parameters.name: projectid
parameters.description: decídalo id of the project.

parameters.name: projectcode
parameters.description: External id of the project.

400.description: If neither projectid nor projectcode is provided.

get.summary: Returns the core project data for all existing projects.
get.description:
If 'onlyProjectsWithProjectCode' is true, only projects with a project code are returned. 
Otherwise, all projects will be returned.

parameters.name: onlyProjectsWithProjectCode
parameters.description: Optional flag that filters out projects without a project code.

200.description: Returns the project data of all projects.

get.summary: Lists all possible working status of a project.

Lists all possible practice areas.

post.description:
The import is processed asynchronously. 
The caller can provide a callback URL to be notified about the completion of the import.
Otherwise the returned BatchID might be used to poll the status of the import.

schema.description: Data container for a whole batch of teams.
Data container for a whole batch of teams.
Data container for a whole batch of teams.

200.description:
Import has been accepted and is being processed in the background. 
The reponse contains the designated id.

post.summary: Imports a batch of teams synchronously.
post.description: The import is processed synchronously. The callback URL is ignored.

schema.description: Data container for a whole batch of teams.

get.summary: Returns data about past imports.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Return only the top few. Ordering is done by CreationDate desc.

parameters.name: status

get.summary: Returns all teams in the system.

post.summary: Returns the input as a test for the workings of this import API setup.

post.description:
The import is processed asynchronously. 
The caller can provide a callback URL to be notified about the completion of the import.
Otherwise the returned BatchID might be used to poll the status of the import.

The impport data has been accepted and is being processed in the background.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Return only the top few. Ordering is done by CreationDate descending.

parameters.name: batchid
parameters.description: Filter for a specific import.

parameters.name: status

get.summary: Returns all users in the system.
get.description: The returned list might be empty if no users match the given criteria.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
Optional filter for the email of an user. 
            Needs to be an exact match (case insensitive).
            If userid is provided, then the email filter is ignored.

parameters.name: userid
parameters.description: Filter for the user id of an user.

get.summary: Returns a list of all custom properties and their description for users.

post.summary: Takes the profile picture and assigns it to the user

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The userid of the user whose picture is to be set.

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: The employee id of the user whose picture is to be set. Will be ignored if userid is provided

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email of the user whose picture is to be set. Will be ignored if either userid or employeeid is provided

formFile.description: The profile picture that is to be set. The accepted file formats are .jpg and .png. Other formats are unfortunately not supported.

post.summary: Creates and Updates a batch of UserWorkingTimePatterns.
post.description:
This endpoint creates and updates UserWorkingTimePatterns.
The Input allows only for StartDates and no EndDates.
All UserWorkingTimePatterns will be created / updated with the given StartDates 
and then the corresponding Enddates will be calculated automatically to one day before the next start date of all UserWorkingTimePatterns.

get.summary: The end point to get all working time patterns.

parameters.name: UserId
parameters.description: The optional field user id which might be used for filtering the results.

userId.description: ID of the user whose absences are imported

subject.description: Informal text displayed in the UI

delete.description: Flag indicating whether the absence should be deleted. If false, absence is created. Default is false.

AbsenceImportItem.description: Represents an imported absence. Will be created or deleted.

userId.description: ID of the user whose absences are imported

subject.description: Informal text displayed in the UI

importStatus.description: Describes the result of the import.

AbsenceImportResult.description: Represents an absence as a result of an import.

userId.description: ID of the user whose absences are imported

subject.description: Informal text displayed in the UI

BatchImportMetadata.description: Represents the current status about any batch import.

BookingBatchInput.description: Data container for a whole batch of users to import.

bookingID.description: The internal ID of the booking.

employeeID.description: The external id of the booked Candidate.

importStatus.description:
The result status for the import item.
Indicates, whether the booking was created or updated.

bookingID.description: The unique internal identifier of the booking. Either this or the bookingCode must be provided.

bookingCode.description: Unique external identifier for a booking entry. Either this or the bookingID must be provided.

absenceCode.description: An AbsenceCode that can be used to identify bookings across different apps.

employeeID.description: The external id of the booked Candidate.

companyID.description: The internal ID of the company linked to the booking.

companyCode.description: The external code to identify the company.

deleted.description:
Flag to indicate, whether this booking should be deleted.
(Default: false)

dailyPlanning.description:
An optional list of daily planning entries.
Entries with a planned time will be added if missing or will overwrite existing planning data.
Entries with zero planned time will be removed.
Any planning days that are *not* provided will be left unchanged.

projectId.description: In case the "internal" project Id is known, it can be used to link the booking to a project.

projectCode.description: Unique identifier for a project. Can be used to link the booking to a project.

bookingAccountingType.description: The booking accounting type of the booking.

bookingAccountingTypeID.description: The booking accounting type id of the booking.

bookingRejectionReason.description: Rejection reason name of the booking.

bookingRejectionReasonID.description: Rejection reason id of the booking.

BookingInput.description: Data structure for a booking to import.

bookingID.description: The internal id of the booking

bookingCode.description: The external ID of a booking

employeeID.description: External ID of the booked user

userID.description: Internal ID of a booked user

capacity.description: The capacity of the booking. A number between 1.0 and 0. Representing how much of the users time is planned for the booking.

companyID.description: Internal identifier of the company linked to this booking.

companyCode.description: External identifier of the company linked to this booking.

projectID.description: Internal identifier of the project linked to the booking.

projectCode.description: External identifier of the project linked to the booking.

bookingAccountingType.description: The accounting type of the booking.

bookingAccountingTypeID.description: The accounting type id of the booking.

bookingRejectionReason.description: The rejection reason of the booking.

bookingRejectionReasonID.description: The rejection reason id of the booking.

recordedTime.description: The amount of time recorded on this booking in minutes.

dailyPlanning.description: Daily planned time for the booking.

lastUpdate.description: The last update timestamp of the booking.

BookingItemOutput.description: Booking entity output in the import api.

businessUnitID.description: Internal ID of the business unit.

companyID.description: The internal ID of the company.

registeredName.description: The registered name of the company.

industryID.description: The internal ID of the industry of the company.

industryName.description: The name of the industry of the company.

isCustomer.description: Indicates whether the company is a customer.

CompanyCreateInput.description: Defines company data for a new company.

companyID.description: decídalo internal id of the company.

CompanyOutput.description: Short display information of a company.

companyCode.description: Optional external identifier for the company, e.g. from an external system.
Optional external identifier for the company, e.g. from an external system.

propertyName.description:
The identifier of the custom property.
Send this as a key for the custom property value.

dataType.description: Describes which content is allowed as value for the custom property.

dataFormat.description: Describes the format in which the custom property value is expected in JSON.

isRequired.description: Indicates whether the custom property is required to be set when creating or updating an entity.

maxLength.description: Specifies the maximum length if the custom property is a string.

options.description:
If the custom property is of type ValueList, then this contains the list of available options.
Null, if it is not a ValueList.

defaultOptionValue.description:
Specifies which of the select options is flagged as the default option.
Can be null, if there is no default.

CustomProperty.description: Describes the schema of a custom property.

CustomPropertyDataFormat.description: Describes the format in which the custom property value is expected in JSON.

CustomPropertyDataType.description: Describes the available data types of custom properties.

value.description:
The identifier for the option. 
Send this value as the custom property value.

label.description: A corresponding label for the option.

CustomPropertyOption.description: Describes one selectable option for a custom property that has a list of options.

calendarDate.description: The day of the planned entry as a pure date

ImportUserWorkingProfileResult.description: Container for the result information of an import operation for a batch of UserWorkingTimePattern.

ImportWorkingProfileResult.description: Container for the result information of an import operation for a single UserWorkingTimePattern.

industryID.description: decídalo internal id of the industry.

IndustryOutput.description: Short display information of an industry.

value.description:
The keyword value case-insensitive.
Must not cointain any whitespace.

KeywordInput.description: Defines a keyword for a project.

practiceAreaID.description: The unique internal identifier of the practice area.

practiceAreaName.description: The name of the practice area.

position.description: The position of the practice area in the list of practice areas.

PracticeArea.description:
Domain Model of a Practice Area.
A Practice Area is a field of expertise or a specialization of a user.

companyID.description: References a company by the decídalo id.

companyCode.description:
References a company by the external id.
If CompanyID is set, then this field is ignored.

companyData.description:
Instead of specifying a reference, a new company can be included.
If the company data is included, then the reference fields are ignored.

ProjectCompanyReferenceInput.description: Referenes a company for a project.

industryName.description:
Name of the industry.
Acts as identifier, if IndustryID is not provided.

ProjectIndustryReferenceInput.description: Data to reference or create an industry.

value.description: Data to reference or create an industry.

projectID.description: The decídalo id of the project.

projectCode.description: Optional external identifier of the project.

ProjectReferenceIdentity.description: Represents the identity of project, which can be specified by different values.

projectID.description: decídalo internal id of the project.

projectCode.description:
External identifier of the project.
This value will also be set/updated on the project if provided.

ProjectReferenceIdentityInput.description: Defines a reference to a project.

projectID.description:
The id of the project.
Might be null, if project creation failed.

projectCode.description:
The external identifier of the project.
Might be null, if project creation failed.

errorMessage.description: The errormessage, if the import failed.

success.description:
A flag to indicate, whether the import was successful.
If not successful, then the ErrorMessage contains more information.

ProjectReferenceImportResult.description: The result of the import of one project.

identifier.description:
The identifier of the project.
Has to be specified in some form.

properties.description:
Properties of the project.
If not set, the properties won't be changed.
The create case requires some properties.

company.description:
Reference to the company, that is the customer of the project.
If not set, the company won't be changed.
To remove the company from the project, set an empty object "{}".

keywords.description:
Full list of keywords for the project.
Keywords not in the list will be removed. An empty list will remove all keywords.
If the field is not provided, the keywords won't be changed.

creator.description:
The user, that is to be set as the creator of the project.
Only used in the create case.

delete.description: Flag to indicate, whether the project should be deleted. (Default: false)

ProjectReferenceInput.description: Input data to import a project.

industry.description: The industry in which the project takes place.

keywords.description: List of keywords of the projects.

name.description:
Name of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.
Required to create new projects.

description.description:
Description of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

notes.description:
Notes of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

startDate.description:
First day of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

endDate.description:
Last day of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

contactPerson.description:
Contact person of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

projectVolume.description:
The money volume of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.
If set, then the currency must be set as well.

projectVolumeCurrency.description:
The currency of the money volume of the project.
The three letter currency code (like 'USD' or 'EUR').
If not set, it will use the client's default value.

isCentralProject.description:
Flag to indicate whether this project is a central project.
If no value is provided, this flag is set to true in the create case.

displayCustomerDataOnCv.description:
Flag to indicate whether the customer data should be displayed on a CV.
If no value is provided, this flag is set to true in the create case.

referenceStatus.description:
Status of the projectreference.
Values like 'Internal' or 'External'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

projectStatus.description:
Status of the project.
Values like 'Unconfirmed', 'Planned', 'Active' or 'Completed'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

projectManager.description:
The primary project manager for the project.
If not provided, the current primary project manager is not changed.
To remove the primary project manager, set UserID to null.

resourceManager.description:
The primary resource manager for the project.
If not provided, the current primary resource manager is not changed.
To remove the primary resource manager, set UserID to null.

salesResponsible.description:
The primary sales responsible for the project.
If not provided, the current primary sales responsible is not changed.
To remove the primary sales responsible, set UserID to null.

projectAssistant.description:
The primary project assistant for the project.
If not provided, the current primary project assistant is not changed.
To remove the primary project assistant, set UserID to null.

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code representing the country of the project.
For example 'DE' or 'GB'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

location.description:
The location of the project.
If not set, it won't be changed.

deliveryModel.description:
Delivery model of the project.
Values like 'Onshore' or 'Offshore'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

businessUnit.description:
Business unit of the project.
Values like 'Sales' or 'Consulting'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

practiceArea.description:
Practice area of the project.
Values like 'Project Management' or 'IT Security'.
If not set, it won't be changed.

customProperties.description:
Custom fields of the project. 
Values can be any primitive type like string, int, bool or DateTime (formatted as string).

ProjectReferencePropertiesInput.description:
Container for the direct properties of a project.
References to other entities (e.g. company) are not included here.

startDate.description:
First day of the project.
Formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

endDate.description:
Last day of the project.
Formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

contactPerson.description: Name of the contact person for this project.

projectVolume.description:
Money volume of the project.
The currency of this amount is specified in ProjectVolumeCurrency.

projectVolumeCurrency.description:
Currency of the project volume as three letter iso codes,
e.g. 'USD' or 'EUR'.

isCentralProject.description: Indicates whether the project is a central project.

displayCustomerDataOnCv.description: Indicates whether the customer data should be displayed on a CV.

referenceStatus.description:
Status of the project reference.
E.g. "Internal" or "External".

projectStatus.description:
Status of the project.
E.g. "Active", "Completed", etc.

projectManager.description: The primary project manager of the project.

resourceManager.description: The primary resource manager responsible for resource allocation and management.

salesResponsible.description: The primary sales responsible person who handled the project sale.

projectAssistant.description: The primary project assistant of the project.

countryCode.description: The two-letter code representing the country of the project.

deliveryModel.description:
Delivery model of the project.
Values like 'Onshore' or 'Offshore'.

businessUnit.description:
Business unit of the project.
Values like 'Sales' or 'Consulting'.

practiceArea.description:
Practice area of the project.
Values like 'Project Management' or 'IT Security'.

customProperties.description:
Custom fields of the project. 
Values can be any primitive type like string, int, bool or DateTime (formatted as string).

ProjectReferencePropertiesOutput.description: Container for the direct properties of a project.

projectStatusID.description: The decídalo id of the project status.

projectStatusName.description: A string representation of the status.

ProjectStatusOutput.description: Represents a possible working status of a project.

referenceStatusID.description: The decídalo id of the status.

referenceStatusName.description: A string representation of the status.

allowReferencing.description: Flag to indicate, whether this status would allow users to add this project to their profiles.

ReferenceStatusOutput.description: Represents a possible publications status of a project as a reference.

requestID.description: decídalo id of the resource request.
decídalo id of the resource request.

identifier.description:
Id of the resource request.
If no Id is provided then a new resource request will be created.

properties.description:
Fields of the resource request that can be set by the user.
If no values are provided, the existing values will be kept.

company.description:
The company for which the resource request is made.
If not supplied, the company will not be changed.
To remove the company from the resource request, set an empty object.
If the company does not exist, it will be created with the provided values.

industry.description:
Target industry for the resource request, if any.
If not supplied, the industry will not be changed.
To remove the industry from the resource request, set an empty object.
If the industry does not exist, it will be created with the provided values.

assignedResourceManager.description:
Assigned user that is responsible for the resource request.
If not supplied, the assigned resource manager will not be changed.
To remove the assigned resource manager from the resource request, set an empty object.
If the user does not exist, it will result in an error.

delete.description:
Flag to indicate, whether the resource request should be deleted.
Default: false.

project.description:
The existing project that we wish to link to the resource request.
It is irrelevant whether the resource request exists or not but at the moment we support only the linking of
already existing projects. 
The link is established by creating a dummy booking which is connected 
on one end with the project and on the other end with the resource request
If the project code or project id does not exist, nothing is going to be linked.

ResourceRequestInput.description: The input data for a resource request.

status.description: Current processing status of the resource request.

properties.description: Fields of the resource request that can be set by the user.

lastEditDate.description: Timestamp of the last change ot the resource request.

company.description: The company for which the resource request is made.

industry.description: Target industry for the resource request, if any.

assignedResourceManager.description: Assigned user that is responsible for the resource request.

project.description: The project that is linked to the resource request.

ResourceRequestOutput.description: The data for a resource request.

title.description: Display title for the resource request.

role.description: Official title of the requested role.

source.description: Data source where the need originated.

requestedCandidateCount.description:
Number of profiles that should be returned for the request.
If no values is specified, new resource requests are created with default '1'.

startDate.description: First day of the time period when the resource is needed.

endDate.description: Last day of the time period when the resource is needed.

contact.description: Notes about the contact person who needs the resource.

ResourceRequestPropertiesInput.description: Container for the properties of a resource request.

title.description: Display title for the resource request.

role.description: Official title of the requested role.

source.description: Data source where the need originated.

requestedCandidateCount.description: Number of profiles that should be returned for the request.

endDate.description: Last day of the time period when the resource is needed.

contact.description: Notes about the contact person who needs the resource.

callback.description: Web hook endpoint to notify about the completion of the import.

userID.description: The unique internal identifier of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

employeeID.description: The employee ID of the user, acts as external identifier.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

yearOfBirth.description: The year of birth of the user.

highestEducation.description: The highest education level of the user.

countryCode.description: The two-letter code of the user's country.

officePhoneNumber.description: The office phone number of the user.

mobilePhoneNumber.description: The mobile phone number of the user.

employeeTypeID.description: The internal id of the employee type.

employeeTypeName.description: The name of the employee type, acting as external identifier.

authorizationRoleID.description: The authorization role ID of the user.

authorizationRoleName.description: The authorization role name of the user.

costCenter.description: The cost center of the user. Used for accounting purposes.

includeInResourceManagement.description:
Flag to indicate, whether this user should be included in the resource management.
(In the create case, the default value is true. In the case of an update, the default value is the user's current value.)

standardWeeklyHours.description: The standard weekly working hours of the user.

entryDate.description: First day, when the user officially joins the company.

exitDate.description: Last day, when the user officially leaves the company.

businessUnitID.description: The internal ID of the business unit.

businessUnitName.description: The name of the business unit.

practiceAreaID.description: Internal decídalo ID of the practice area of the user

practiceAreaName.description: The English name of the practice area of the user

companyName.description:
The name of the company, where the user works.
Acts as an identifier.

delete.description:
Flag to indicate, whether this user should be deleted.
(Default: false)

deactivate.description:
Flag to indicate, whether this user should be deactivated.
Sending false will reactivate the user.

hasLogin.description:
Flag to indicate, whether this user should have a login.
null: No change or don't create for new users.
false: Remove login for existing users.

deliveryModel.description:
The delivery model of the user.
E.g. Offshore, Onshore or Nearshore

customProperties.description:
Custom fields of the user. 
Values can be any primitive type like string, int, bool or DateTime (formatted as string).

holidayListCode.description:
The combination of Country and subdivision codes separated by a hyphen which determine the usual list of Holidays of the User.
The part preceeding the hyphen is the country code according to the ISO 3166-2 standard and the part succeeding it is the code of the region according to ISO 3166-2 standard.
Example: DE-NI corresponds to the list of holidays in the region NiederSachsen of Germany.
The first part that is DE is the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard nomenclature for Germany.
The second part that is NI denotes the ISO 3166-2 standard nomenclature for NiederSachsen.
Note that the ISO 3166-2 nomenclature for certain regions maybe numeric. For example: AT-6 denotes holidays in Steiermark in Austria.
Also one can have a code without any subdivision Code. For example: DE which would then represent the list of holidays in Germany. 
DE being the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard nomenclature for germany.

legalEntityID.description: This is the technical Id of the legal entity corressponding to the User.

legalEntityName.description: This is the name corresponding to the legal entity of the user.

serviceLineID.description: This is the technical Id of the service line corressponding to the user.

serviceLineName.description: This is the name corressponding to the service line of the user.

UserInput.description: Data structure for a user to import.

userID.description: The unique internal identifier of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

employeeID.description: The employee ID of the user, acts as external identifier.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

yearOfBirth.description: The year of birth of the user.

highestEducation.description: The highest education level of the user.

countryCode.description: The two-letter code of the user's country.

officePhoneNumber.description: The office phone number of the user.

mobilePhoneNumber.description: The mobile phone number of the user.

employeeTypeID.description: The internal id of the employee type.

employeeTypeName.description: The name of the employee type, acting as external identifier.

authorizationRoleID.description: The authorization role ID of the user.

authorizationRoleName.description: The authorization role name of the user.

teamID.description: The team ID of the user.

teamCode.description: The team code of the user.

serviceCategoryName.description: The service category name of the user.

lastEditDate.description: Date when user was last edited.

costCenter.description: The cost center of the user.

includeInResourceManagement.description: Flag to indicate, whether this is included in the resource management.

entryDate.description: First day, when the user officially joins the company.

exitDate.description: Last day, when the user officially leaves the company.

businessUnitID.description: The internal ID of the business unit.

businessUnitName.description: The name of the business unit.

practiceAreaID.description: Internal decídalo ID of the practice area of the user

practiceAreaName.description: The English name of the practice area of the user

companyName.description:
The name of the company, where the user works.
Acts as an identifier.

hasLogin.description: Flag to indicate, whether this user has a login.

customProperties.description: Custom fields of the user. Values can be any primitive type like string, int, bool or DateTime (formatted as string).

deliveryModelName.description: The delivery model of the User. Ex: Offshore,Onshore, Nearshore etc.

standardWeeklyHours.description: The standard weekly hours of the user.

holidayListCode.description: The combination of the country and region codes which tell us which holidays are applicable for the user.

holidayListId.description: The technical internal Id corresponding to the list of Holidays of the user.

deactivationDate.description: Timestamp of the soft delete. If null, the user is active, otherwise it is deactivated.

legalEntityID.description: The technical internal Id corresponding to the legal entity of the user.

legalEntityName.description: It is the name of the legal entity corresponding to the user.

serviceLineID.description: The technical Id corresponding to the service line of the user.

serviceLineName.description: The name of the service line corresponding to the user.

UserOverview.description: Class is used to display existing user data in a batch list of existing users already present in the system

userID.description: References the user by the decídalo id.

employeeID.description:
References the user by the external id.
Gets ignored, if UserID is set.

userID.description: References the user by the decídalo id.

employeeID.description: References the user by the external id.

workingTimePatterns.description: Defines multiple WorkingTimePatterns from a user.

UserWorkingProfileInput.description: Defines a user with the associated WorkingTimePatterns.

monday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Monday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is true.

tuesday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Tuesday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is true.

wednesday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Wednesday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is true.

thursday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Thursday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is true.

friday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Friday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is true.

saturday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Saturday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is false.

sunday.description:
Flag to indicate whether Sunday should be a working day.
If not provided in the create case, the default is false.

WeekDaysInput.description:
Defines the working days of a UserWorkingTimePattern.
If this is not provided in the create case, then the default is Monday to Friday.

userWorkingTimePatternCode.description:
External identifier for the UserWorkingTimePattern.
Will be set and updated if provided.

startDate.description:
The Start date of the working time pattern.
The corresponding end date is automatically set to one day before the next start date of all UserWorkingTimePatterns.

hoursPerWeek.description:
The working hours per week.
This field is mandatory in the create case.

hoursPerDay.description:
The working hours per day.
This field is mandatory in the create case.

maxHoursPerDay.description: The maximum working hours per day.

weekDays.description:
Defines the days on which the user works.
If this is not provided in the create case, then the default is Monday to Friday.

WorkingProfileInput.description: Defines a working time pattern with a StartDate.

ApiKey.description: API Key needed to access the endpoints. API Key must be in the format: "X-Api-Key: {your_api_key}"
ApiKey.name: X-Api-Key
